noun.description: A chemical substance that neutralizes alkalis, dissolves some metals, and turns litmus red; typically, a corrosive or sour-tasting liquid of this kind.
examples: rainwater is a very weak acid

noun.description: A molecule or other entity that can donate a proton or accept an electron pair in reactions.

adjective.description: Containing acid or having the properties of an acid; having a pH of less than 7.
(of rock, especially lava) containing a relatively high proportion of silica.

origin: Early 17th century (in the sense sour-tasting): from Latin acidus, from acere be sour.
